text: today I'm making a delicious banana
muffin and I'm replacing half of the
white flour with whole wheat flour for a
let's just say slightly healthier
version in my bowl I have one cup each
of all-purpose flour and whole wheat
flour and to that add one teaspoon of
baking powder one teaspoon of baking
soda and a half a teaspoon of salt give
it a little whisk just to get everything
combined you actually don't have to have
to do this stuff but it's just habit for
me I always whisk my dry ingredients
together before I start in my mixer I
have four ripe bananas you want to beat
those just until they turn to a mush you
can also mash these by hand and then you
don't need to use a mixer at all
but if you're using your mixer this is a
great way to get your bananas to be a
puree when your banana seem nice and
broken down you can add your sugar today
I'm using 1 cup of light brown sugar 1/2
a cup of canola oil or you can use
melted butter I do that sometimes
or if you're really going crazy you can
use coconut oil which is also very
delicious I don't know if that's going
crazy but that would add a very tropical
flavor to your banana muffins and I bet
that would be delicious and one large
egg beat that to combine
add a teaspoon of pure vanilla extract
half a cup of sour cream
and then your dry ingredients Chur and
then you just be it's come on you can do
this by hand for sure it's a little high
because it's flying a little bit but
it'll stop that's it get your oven
preheating always ahead of time it'll
take probably about 20 minutes for your
oven to preheat so think about that when
your recipe only takes about 10 minutes
to come together it needs to be at 350 I
always like to give my mixture a stir in
case there's any flour stuck on the
sides of the bowl or on the bottom of
the bowl
sometimes these larger bowls everything
flies up the sides and it doesn't get
well incorporated especially if it's a
smallish batter so make sure you give it
one last stir with a rubber spatula and
then if you're interested in a nice
little garnish you can slice up another
banana for the top and of course I am
because I like things to be cute as well
as delicious so this makes 12 muffins so
make 12 nice slices of banana for the
tops breast is for a snack mmm perfectly
right want to make sure that your
bananas are ripe for this recipe fill
the muffin tins about 3/4 full with the
batter I have mine lined with paper
baking cups which I think is important
here just makes cleanup so much easier
okie-doke garnishing place one little
banana slice on the top of each one
place these into the oven and bake them
until the top springs back when lightly
touched that'll take about 25 minutes
for these full-size muffins and if
you're making mini muffins it'll take
about 20 minutes
let the muffins cool before you eat them
and I think that if you want to put some
of these in your freezer they would do
really well in your freezer and you can
take one out whenever you want one but
aren't they adorable I really think it's
worth going the extra step and putting
that banana on top mmm mmm they're so
tender delicious banana e muffins
it's a great and easy recipe to add to
your repertoire give it a try if you
like recipes like this and you want more
make sure to click like and subscribe
because we have plenty more where this
came from
[Music]
